version.description: The version of Big Bang to use

repo.description: Override repo to pull Big Bang from instead of Repo One

valuesFiles.description: The list of values files to pass to Big Bang; these will be merged together

skipFlux.description: Whether to skip deploying flux; Defaults to false

showOutput.description: Show the output of the script during package deployment

timeoutSeconds.description: Timeout in seconds for the script

retry.description: Retry the script if it fails

prepare.description: Scripts to run before the component is added during package create

before.description: Scripts to run before the component is deployed

after.description: Scripts to run after the component successfully deploys

terminal.description: The machine name that created this package

user.description: The username who created this package

architecture.description: The architecture this package was created on

timestamp.description: The timestamp when this package was created

version.description: The version of Zarf used to build this package

migrations.description: Any migrations that have been run on this package

differential.description: Whether this package was created with differential components

registryOverrides.description: Any registry domains that were overridden on package create when pulling images

differentialMissing.description: List of components that were not included in this package due to differential packaging

OCIImportedComponents.description: Map of components that were imported via OCI. The keys are OCI Package URLs and values are the component names

name.description: The name of the chart to deploy; this should be the name of the chart as it is installed in the helm repo

releaseName.description: The name of the release to create; defaults to the name of the chart

url.description: The URL of the OCI registry, chart repository, or git repo where the helm chart is stored

version.description: The version of the chart to deploy; for git-based charts this is also the tag of the git repo

namespace.description: The namespace to deploy the chart to

valuesFiles.description: List of local values file paths or remote URLs to include in the package; these will be merged together

gitPath.description: The path to the chart in the repo if using a git repo instead of a helm repo

localPath.description: The path to the chart folder

noWait.description: Whether to not wait for chart resources to be ready before continuing

description.description: Message to include during package deploy describing the purpose of this component

default.description: Determines the default Y/N state for installing this component on package deploy

required.description: Do not prompt user to install this component

only.description: Filter when this component is included in package creation or deployment

group.description: Create a user selector field based on all components in the same group

cosignKeyPath.description: Specify a path to a public key to validate signed online resources

import.description: Import a component from another Zarf package

scripts.description: [Deprecated] (replaced by actions) Custom commands to run before or after package deployment

files.description: Files or folders to place on disk during package deployment

charts.description: Helm charts to install during package deploy

manifests.description: Kubernetes manifests to be included in a generated Helm chart on package deploy

images.description: List of OCI images to include in the package

repos.description: List of git repos to include in the package

dataInjections.description: Datasets to inject into a container in the target cluster

extensions.description: Extend component functionality with additional features

actions.description: Custom commands to run at various stages of a package lifecycle

mute.description: Hide the output of the command during package deployment (default false)

maxTotalSeconds.description: Timeout in seconds for the command (default to 0

maxRetries.description: Retry the command if it fails up to given number of times (default 0)

dir.description: The working directory to run the command in (default is CWD)

env.description: Additional environment variables to set for the command

cmd.description: The command to run. Must specify either cmd or wait for the action to do anything.

shell.description: (cmd only) Indicates a preference for a shell for the provided cmd to be executed in on supported operating systems

setVariable.description: [Deprecated] (replaced by setVariables) (onDeploy/cmd only) The name of a variable to update with the output of the command. This variable will be available to all remaining actions and components in the package.

setVariables.description: (onDeploy/cmd only) An array of variables to update with the output of the command. These variables will be available to all remaining actions and components in the package.

description.description: Description of the action to be displayed during package execution instead of the command

wait.description: Wait for a condition to be met before continuing. Must specify either cmd or wait for the action. See the 'zarf tools wait-for' command for more info.

mute.description: Hide the output of commands during execution (default false)

maxTotalSeconds.description: Default timeout in seconds for commands (default to 0

maxRetries.description: Retry commands given number of times if they fail (default 0)

shell.description: (cmd only) Indicates a preference for a shell for the provided cmd to be executed in on supported operating systems

defaults.description: Default configuration for all actions in this set

before.description: Actions to run at the start of an operation

after.description: Actions to run at the end of an operation

onSuccess.description: Actions to run if all operations succeed

onFailure.description: Actions to run if all operations fail

name.description: The name to be used for the variable

sensitive.description: Whether to mark this variable as sensitive to not print it in the Zarf log

autoIndent.description: Whether to automatically indent the variable's value (if multiline) when templating. Based on the number of chars before the start of ###ZARF_VAR_.

windows.description: (default 'powershell') Indicates a preference for the shell to use on Windows systems (note that choosing 'cmd' will turn off migrations like touch -> New-Item)

linux.description: (default 'sh') Indicates a preference for the shell to use on Linux systems

darwin.description: (default 'sh') Indicates a preference for the shell to use on macOS systems

cluster.description: Wait for a condition to be met in the cluster before continuing. Only one of cluster or network can be specified.

network.description: Wait for a condition to be met on the network before continuing. Only one of cluster or network can be specified.

kind.description: The kind of resource to wait for

name.description: The name of the resource or selector to wait for

namespace.description: The namespace of the resource to wait for

condition.description: The condition or jsonpath state to wait for; defaults to exist

code.description: The HTTP status code to wait for if using http or https

onCreate.description: Actions to run during package creation

onDeploy.description: Actions to run during package deployment

onRemove.description: Actions to run during package removal

bigbang.description: Configurations for installing Big Bang and Flux in the cluster

name.description: The name of the component to import from the referenced zarf.yaml

path.description: The relative path to a directory containing a zarf.yaml to import from

url.description: [beta] The URL to a Zarf package to import via OCI

architecture.description: Only create and deploy to clusters of the given architecture

distros.description: A list of kubernetes distros this package works with (Reserved for future use)

localOS.description: Only deploy component to specified OS

cluster.description: Only deploy component to specified clusters

namespace.description: The namespace to target for data injection

selector.description: The K8s selector to target for data injection

container.description: The container name to target for data injection

path.description: The path within the container to copy the data into

source.description: Either a path to a local folder/file or a remote URL of a file to inject into the given target pod + container

target.description: The target pod + container to inject the data into

compress.description: Compress the data before transmitting using gzip.  Note: this requires support for tar/gzip locally and in the target image.

source.description: Local folder or file path or remote URL to pull into the package

shasum.description: (files only) Optional SHA256 checksum of the file

target.description: The absolute or relative path where the file or folder should be copied to during package deploy

executable.description: (files only) Determines if the file should be made executable during package deploy

symlinks.description: List of symlinks to create during package deploy

name.description: A name to give this collection of manifests; this will become the name of the dynamically-created helm chart

namespace.description: The namespace to deploy the manifests to

files.description: List of local K8s YAML files or remote URLs to deploy (in order)

kustomizeAllowAnyDirectory.description: Allow traversing directory above the current directory if needed for kustomization

kustomizations.description: List of local kustomization paths or remote URLs to include in the package

noWait.description: Whether to not wait for manifest resources to be ready before continuing

name.description: Name to identify this Zarf package

version.description: Generic string set by a package author to track the package version (Note: ZarfInitConfigs will always be versioned to the CLIVersion they were created with)

url.description: Link to package information when online

image.description: An image URL to embed in this package (Reserved for future use in Zarf UI)

architecture.description: The target cluster architecture for this package

authors.description: Comma-separated list of package authors (including contact info)

documentation.description: Link to package documentation when online

source.description: Link to package source code when online

vendor.description: Name of the distributing entity, organization or individual.

aggregateChecksum.description: Checksum of a checksums.txt file that contains checksums all the layers within the package.

components.description: List of components to deploy in this package

constants.description: Constant template values applied on deploy for K8s resources

variables.description: Variable template values applied on deploy for K8s resources

value.description: The value to set for the constant during deploy
